pylovo

generate_editable_network.js

GetPandapowerAndWriteGeoJSONNet()

gets called when the window is first loaded, retrieves preprocessed Geojson data from the backend and calls necessary functions to display network on the map and fill editor windows

changeTrafoBusNames(busList, trafoList)

The buses connected to the trafo need to have specific names to work with urbs later so we change them here

Arguments:

  • busList (list) – list of all buses

  • trafoList (list) – list of all trafos

extractStdTypes(ppdata)

small aggregate function for all std types

Arguments:

  • ppdata (dict) – dict retrieved from the backend

displayNetNew(ppdata)

aggregate function calling the actual functions that place the feature geojsons on the leaflet map

Arguments:

  • ppdata (dict) – dict retrieved from the backend

addGeoJSONtoMap(isLines, input_geoJSON, featureName)

function that adds a FeatureCollection to the leaflet map we set styles and onclick functions here and save references to each added feature in the NetworkObject lines (lines, trafos) and circlemarkers (buses, ext_grids) need to be handled differently because lines do not have the pointToLayer function

Arguments:

  • isLines (boolean) – distinguishes if the geometry we want to place on the map is a point or a line

  • input_geoJSON (geoJSON_FeatureCollection) – the data structure containing all our grid information

  • featureName (string) – name of the feature type to be added to the map (e.g. line, bus etc)
